SEARCH
Package de.happybavarian07.coolstufflib.commandmanagement

Annotationsschnittstelle CommandData

@Retention(RUNTIME) @Target(TYPE) public @interface CommandData
CommandData annotation.

  • Optionale Elemente - Übersicht

    Optionale Elemente
    Modifizierer und Typ
    Optionales Element
    Beschreibung
    boolean
    allowOnlySubCommandArgsThatFitToSubArgs
    Specifies whether only sub-command arguments that match the defined sub-command arguments are allowed.
    int
    maxArgs
    Specifies the maximum number of arguments allowed for a command.
    int
    minArgs
    Specifies the minimum number of arguments required for the associated command.
    boolean
    opRequired
    Specifies whether operator (op) permissions are required to execute a command.
    boolean
    playerRequired
    Specifies whether a command requires a player as the sender.
    boolean
    senderTypeSpecificSubArgs
    Specifies whether the command should allow subcommand arguments specific to the sender type.

  • Elementdetails

    • playerRequired

      boolean playerRequired
      Specifies whether a command requires a player as the sender.

      This method is a part of the CommandData annotation and determines if the associated command must be executed by a player. If this returns true, other types of command senders (e.g., server console or command blocks) will not be able to execute the annotated command.

      Gibt zurück:
      true if the command requires a player as the sender; false otherwise.
      Standard:
      false

    • opRequired

      boolean opRequired
      Specifies whether operator (op) permissions are required to execute a command.

      When set to true, the command will only be executable by players or entities with op (operator) permissions. Otherwise, the command can be executed by any sender with the necessary non-op-specific permissions.

      Gibt zurück:
      true if the command requires operator permissions; false if no specific operator permissions are required (default is false).
      Standard:
      false

    • allowOnlySubCommandArgsThatFitToSubArgs

      boolean allowOnlySubCommandArgsThatFitToSubArgs
      Specifies whether only sub-command arguments that match the defined sub-command arguments are allowed. This is used to enforce strict matching of sub-arguments to ensure command inputs conform to expected patterns or rules.

      If set to true, sub-command arguments must align precisely with the allowed sub-arguments. If set to false, sub-command arguments are not strictly constrained.

      Gibt zurück:
      true if only sub-command arguments that fit to defined sub-arguments are allowed; false otherwise. Default is false.
      Standard:
      false

    • senderTypeSpecificSubArgs

      boolean senderTypeSpecificSubArgs
      Specifies whether the command should allow subcommand arguments specific to the sender type.

      When this value is set to true, the command system may enforce certain subcommand arguments based on the type of the sender (e.g., Player vs. Console).

      Gibt zurück:
      true if subcommand arguments should be restricted based on the sender type; false otherwise.
      Standard:
      false

    • minArgs

      int minArgs
      Specifies the minimum number of arguments required for the associated command.

      This attribute is used to ensure that a command has at least the specified number of arguments provided upon execution.

      Gibt zurück:
      the minimum number of arguments required; defaults to 0 if not specified.
      Standard:
      0

    • maxArgs

      int maxArgs
      Specifies the maximum number of arguments allowed for a command.

      This parameter is used to define the upper limit on the number of arguments that can be passed to a command. It can help in validation and ensuring commands are invoked with the correct amount of data.

      • If not explicitly defined, the default value is Integer.MAX_VALUE, which means there is no practical restriction on the number of arguments.
      Gibt zurück:
      the maximum number of arguments allowed for the command. Defaults to Integer.MAX_VALUE.
      Standard:
      2147483647
